ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Zarechensk school
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: The Zarechensk school apparently belongs to some rather old people. It is based on rough blows, which at first glance have no practical meaning and were used simply because of development, but delving into the basics, it becomes clear that rather effective techniques for using axes are hidden behind rough and clumsy techniques.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Dueling stance
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: A special stand for 1 on 1 duels. It does not affect the shooting accuracy, for that it allows you to potentially dodge a flying bullet at the cost of a long reloading of the weapon and mobility.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Weaver stance
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: The Vivep stand looks like a normal combat stand in the side. A strong hand wraps around the hand of a gun and is slightly bent in the lock, turned to the side of the weak hand. A weak woman's hand, as usual, wraps around the brush strong, but at this it is noticeably bent, and the blade will look down. Hoga on the side of the weak hand is carried forward and slightly bent in the knee, on the side of the strong - the leg is straight, pushed back, and turned 45 °. The body is slightly inclined forward. Became transferred to the forward leg.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Modified weaver stance
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: The Vivep stand looks like a normal combat stand in the side. A strong hand wraps around the hand of a gun and is slightly bent in the lock, turned to the side of the weak hand. A weak woman's hand, as usual, wraps around the brush strong, but at this it is noticeably bent, and the blade will look down. Hoga on the side of the weak hand is carried forward and slightly bent in the knee, on the side of the strong - the leg is straight, pushed back, and turned 45 °. The body is slightly inclined forward. Became transferred to the forward leg.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Israeli stance
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: Flexion of the knees when shooting, coupled with a longer leg extension, allows for better control of the recoil of the weapon, but requires more stamina than in a standard stance.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Quick-dro
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: Shooting from the hip without aiming. Allows you to shoot faster, but accuracy is out of the question.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Gun-kata
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: A legendary police skill in one of the worlds of the galaxy, it combines melee and firearms, taking close-range combat to an unattainable level.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Steppe school
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: The steppe school was developed in the days of the dense Middle Ages in the cradle of mankind. The main advantage of the nomads was the numerical superiority and sudden appearance. Horse archers showed their best side in such battles, which determined the tactics of the nomads for many years.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Antique school
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: The ancient school appeared and was firmly entrenched in human civilization many thousands of years ago and is relevant even today. The short sword and wait-and-see stance epitomizes this fighting style, which is also used by numerous famous xenos.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Greek school
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: This fighting style assumes a combat formation. This allows the next ranks behind the front line to operate effectively and be protected from a head-on attack. Basically, the formation consists of several rows of spearmen, covered with shields.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Samurai path
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: A samurai is an ancient warrior armed with a bow and long sword. Its main advantage is the accuracy of attacks and mental pressure due to direct eye contact,

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Strelets
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: Strelets prefers to use firearms such as muskets, rifles and pistols, relying on suppression by fire.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Shio style
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: A defensive style of fencing used in pivot and semi-pivot defense. The warrior must watch out position the enemy in each side and attack for a chance of survival.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Barbarian
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: Rough technique of inflicting heavy and energetic blows with a battle ax. The main purpose of the technique is constant onslaught.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Assassin
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: The Assassin is a hitman or robber who uses sneaky blows from the dark or surprise blows.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Gladiator style
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: The Gladiator is an ancient warrior whose every fight could be the last. This circumstance forced to use their abilities to the maximum.

ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.label: Legionnaire style
ProjectParagon.Core.FightSystem.Fighting.description: The main weapon of the legionnaire was a short sword and a good shield, and the fighting style assumed a well-coordinated formation of comrades in arms.
